video.title: Using icons on the web with Ionicons
video.description:
Learn how to use the Ionicons Icon Set (part of the Ionic Framework) on your own websites or web applications.

Ionicons comes with over 700 high quality icons with designs for both Material Design Style and iOS Style - you can choose them as you please!

Video from dcode. Check out the dcode channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjX0FtIZBBVD3YoCcxnDC4g

Twitter: @dcode

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.text: Is it possible for me to add text next to ion-icon within this customized tag? I tried it but nothing was showing aside from the icon itself :/

topLevelComment.text: Super cool tutorial  Thank you for sharing it with us!

topLevelComment.author: Deni Wassulmaier
topLevelComment.text:
I don't understand why this methodof using icons is better, then create sprite file with svg icons, and just put icon in every place you want by <use> construction? 
In that method i need to include js file, which takes icons from another site, in svg sprite method and <use> construction you use only icons what you need, and that's all.

topLevelComment.author: RAKSHITH S N
topLevelComment.text: Thank you so much Sir, Very Informative...

topLevelComment.author: Goran Tomičić
topLevelComment.text:
Good tut, short and sweet!


P.s. which VSCode syntax theme are you using? I love it :)

topLevelComment.author: dcode
topLevelComment.text: Glad to see you guys liked this tutorial also! Head over to my channel for more like this one :)

topLevelComment.author: Phillip Shim
topLevelComment.text: Is this better than font awesome? Reason to use this over font-awesome?

replies.author: Oscar Rios
replies.text: This one is totally open source and really good. That's why freecodecamp is pushing them over font awesome. I totally recommend it

replies.author: dcode
replies.text: It's not "better" but it's an alternative, from my experience Font Awesome usually has more variety but I find Ionicons to be a bit sleeker, only slightly
